intro: Adinandra dubia, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its attractive, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite, simple, and have a slightly waxy texture. Adinandra dubia is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and is found in various habitats including forests and shrublands.
